CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: When CB was used as the solvent , all the combinations showed a relatively low PCE of 0.87% , 1.97% and 1.92% in the devices with PDTP-BT : PC 70 BM , PDTP - DTBT : PC 70 BM and PDTP-DT2BT : PC 70 BM respectively.

Let's think step by step.

In the given paragraph, the following are the "Material Name" entities:

1. CB - Chloroform (a solvent)
2. PCE - Photocatalytic efficiency (a measure of the device's performance)
3. PDTP-BT - Poly(3,4-ethylenedioxythiophene) (a type of polymer)
4. PC 70 BM - Poly(70% by weight of butadiene) (a type of polymer)
5. DTBT - Dibutyl tartarate (a type of organic compound)
6. PDTP-DT2BT - Poly(3,4-ethylenedioxythiophene) with 2-butyl-1,3-dioxolane (a type of organic compound)

Note that some of these entities are mentioned multiple times in the paragraph, but they are listed here only once with their corresponding abbreviations.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

Of course! Here are the relevant entities from the paragraph that refer to "Material Name":

1. PDTP-BT
2. PC 70 BM
3. PDTP-DT2BT

These are the only entities in the paragraph that refer directly to "Material Name".

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the valid entities from the paragraph that refer to "Material Name", presented in a Markdown table with one column titled "Material Name":

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PDTP-BT |
| PC 70 BM |
| PDTP-DT2BT |

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: When CB was used as the solvent , all the combinations showed a relatively low PCE of 0.87% , 1.97% and 1.92% in the devices with PDTP-BT : PC 70 BM , PDTP - DTBT : PC 70 BM and PDTP-DT2BT : PC 70 BM respectively.

Let's think step by step.

In the given paragraph, the following are the "Property Name" entities:

1. PCE - Percentage of Composition of the Electrode
2. PDTP - Polymeric Dopant-Doped Thin Film
3. BT - Bismuth Telluride
4. PC - Polycrystalline
5. DTBT - Doped Bismuth Telluride
6. DT2BT - Doped Bismuth Telluride (second mention)

Note that some of these entities are mentioned multiple times in the paragraph, but they are distinct entities with different names.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Property.

Sure, here are the relevant entities that refer to Material Property in the given paragraph:

1. PCE - Percentage of Composition of the Electrode (Material Property)
2. PC - Polycrystalline (Material Property)
3. BT - Bismuth Telluride (Material Property)
4. DTBT - Doped Bismuth Telluride (Material Property)
5. DT2BT - Doped Bismuth Telluride (Material Property)

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the valid entities that refer to Material Property in the given paragraph, presented in a Markdown table with one column "Property Name":

| Property Name |
| --- |
| PCE - Percentage of Composition of the Electrode |
| PC - Polycrystalline |
| BT - Bismuth Telluride |
| DTBT - Doped Bismuth Telluride |
| DT2BT - Doped Bismuth Telluride |

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: When CB was used as the solvent , all the combinations showed a relatively low PCE of 0.87% , 1.97% and 1.92% in the devices with PDTP-BT : PC 70 BM , PDTP - DTBT : PC 70 BM and PDTP-DT2BT : PC 70 BM respectively.

Let's think step by step.

In the given paragraph, the following are the "Property Value" entities:

1. PCE (Percentage of Compressive Strength after Exposure) - This is the property value that is being measured in the experiment, and it is mentioned in the paragraph as a percentage.
2. 0.87% - This is the value of PCE for the combination of CB (solvent) and PDTP-BT : PC 70 BM.
3. 1.97% - This is the value of PCE for the combination of CB (solvent) and PDTP-BT : PC 70 BM.
4. 1.92% - This is the value of PCE for the combination of CB (solvent) and PDTP-DT2BT : PC 70 BM.

Therefore, the Property Value entities in the paragraph are PCE and the specific values of PCE for each combination of solvent (CB) and polymer (PDTP-BT : PC 70 BM, PDTP-DTBT : PC 70 BM, and PDTP-DT2BT : PC 70 BM).
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

Sure, here are the entities that refer to the value of material properties in the given paragraph:

1. PCE (Percentage of Compressive Strength after Exposure) - This is the value of the material property that is being measured in the experiment.

Therefore, the only entity that refers to the value of a material property in the paragraph is PCE (Percentage of Compressive Strength after Exposure).

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the valid entities in the paragraph, presented in a Markdown table with one column titled "Property Value":

| Property Value |
| --- |
| PCE (Percentage of Compressive Strength after Exposure) |

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.
